ios.subtitle: From Farming Town to Big City

editorialNotes.standard: Custom decks, quick matches, and new twists make this smartly designed mobile spin on the beloved card collector a great fit for both newcomers and veterans.
Brew and serve espressos, lattes, and other caffeinated concoctions while building a bustling business in this charming coffee shop sim from the makers of Good Pizza, Great Pizza.

We wouldn’t be surprised if Subway Surfers kept its spot near the top of the charts for decades to come. Its heart is the key to its stamina, revealed in loving details lavished on cities from Chicago to Shenzhen in its World Tours or in the lovable ruffians awarded in its frequent events. It’s a cinch to pick up, but we’re still finding new ways to master it years and miles later.
There’s a new king in town! Upgrade entire realms while battling an evil Dark King in the slick follow-up to Royal Match.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: This action-packed sequel hits its mark thanks to a quiver full of tweaks, including faster battles, PvP matches, and fantastic new skills to discover.

name: Tomb of the Mask: Pixel Maze

editorialNotes.standard: Speed is survival in this devilishly fast tomb-raiding arcade game. Like some glorious mix of Indiana Jones and Pac-Man, you race from room to room, nabbing all the coins you can while staying ahead of an ever-moving (and lethal) wall. With its crafty mazes, tricky traps, simple controls, and eye-popping retro minimalism, it’s an experience you’ll happily lose yourself in.

editorialNotes.tagline: Tons of fun on one screen

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Cat Sorter: Match by Color Fun

editorialNotes.standard: Hipster Whale's Apple Design Award–winning game takes a timeless arcade formula—cross a road bustling with traffic and deadly obstacles—and transforms it into an adorable infinite runner. As you progress, you’ll unlock new characters with wildly diverse looks and effects. There’s a teeny-tiny flea, an emo goose, and even a few characters from other games—like Epoch, who sprays cars with blocky bullets. The creativity and care put into Crossy Road’s wacky world are unmistakable.
editorialNotes.short: These games are tough, but without a challenge, what's the point of ruling leaderboards?
